column4: After installing the 'additional drivers' for my AMD graphics card, I am no longer able to select a resolution of greater than 1920x1920.
I need a res of 5760x1080
I have three monitors, before installing the drivers I had my desktop across all three
check 'amd catalyst control center' app
thanks
probably compiz
http://askubuntu.com/questions/38028/performance-being-really-choppy-with-ati-drivers see this, answer #1
i have 120hz lcd myself, compiz'es default limitation of 50fps.. THAT was choppy :)
just drag it to the max (200)
oh boy... ccsm. I'm scared.
hehe.. be careful with it. only do those tasks
that happened to me too. Except with the application 'mumble'
do i need to reboot after the compiz?
logout should be enough
http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Oneiric_Installation_Guide#Create_.deb_packages.
basically just download, chmod the file, run buildpkg, install debs, initial config, and reboot
the 11.9 is installed
just install on top of old debs, works
the installer is complaining the old one isn't uninstalled
build the debs, don't run the installer itself
then dpkg -i *deb
it says it generated it and put it in the current dir, it didn't
you might be missing the required tools then: http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Oneiric_Installation_Guide#Before_you_start
yeah i read the log and got the right ones
